alert.note: Alert for Carteret; Craven; Dare; Hyde; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 12 at 10:40AM EST until March 12 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Craven County in eastern North Carolina... Central Hyde County in eastern North Carolina... Central Dare County in eastern North Carolina... Carteret County in eastern North Carolina... Central Pamlico County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 1145 AM EST. * At 1039 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bodie Island Lighthouse to near Hammocks Beach State Park, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... New Bern, Havelock, Morehead City, Newport, Stumpy Point, Cedar Island, Frisco, Harkers Island, South River, Cape Carteret, North River, Buxton, Waves, Davis, Swindell Fork, Straits, Atlantic, Salvo, Sealevel and Marshallberg. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for eastern North Carolina.
